docs.snippet: Ultima Hora, a leftist afternoon daily, has been suspended from publication for the next 20 days, its publishers said today.
docs.lead_paragraph: Ultima Hora, a leftist afternoon daily, has been suspended from publication for the next 20 days, its publishers said today.
docs.abstract: publishers of Uruguayan Leftist daily Ultima Hora rept on Aug 9 that Govt had ordered publication suspended for next 20 days

headline.main: Leftist Daily in Uruguay Suspended by Government

docs.snippet: A worldwide survey by correspondents of The New York Times in the last week has indicated that although foreign leaders and public figures now seem to take the Watergate scandal more seriously than they did a few months ago,
docs.lead_paragraph: A worldwide survey by correspondents of The New York Times in the last week has indicated that although foreign leaders and public figures now seem to take the Watergate scandal more seriously than they did a few months ago,

headline.main: Study Shows Nixon Supported Abroad Despite Watergate; Watergate Impact Abroad Mild

docs.snippet: A worldwide survey by correspondents of The New York Times in the last week has indicated that although foreign leaders and public figures now seem to take the Watergate scandal more seriously than they did a few months ago, the affair has not so far...
docs.lead_paragraph: A worldwide survey by correspondents of The New York Times in the last week has indicated that although foreign leaders and public figures now seem to take the Watergate scandal more seriously than they did a few months ago, the affair has not so far cut deeply into their widespread support for Mr. Nixon's course in foreign policy.
docs.abstract: NY Times survey of world reaction to Watergate indicates that although foreign leaders and public figures now seem to take Watergate scandal more seriously than they did few mos ago, affair has not so far cut deeply into their widespread support for Nixon; concludes that chief focus of concern is that Cong will pre-empt President's powers in foreign policy; that USSR and Chinese leaders still require that their media ignore Watergate as much as possible; that there has been no sign that Watergate has crippled any ongoing negotiations or otherwise set back normal diplomatic business; that despite cloud over Nixon's reputation, he still plans to visit Europe this fall or early next yr

headline.main: Study Shows Nixon Supported Abroad Despite Watergate; Watergate Impact Abroad Mild

docs.snippet: Government sources said today that Argentina had agreed to ship Uruguay 60,000 tons of wheat despite her own shortage of the cereal. The first Argentine shipment of some 7,500 tons is expected next Monday, the sources said.
docs.lead_paragraph: Government sources said today that Argentina had agreed to ship Uruguay 60,000 tons of wheat despite her own shortage of the cereal. The first Argentine shipment of some 7,500 tons is expected next Monday, the sources said.
docs.abstract: Uruguayan Govt sources rept on Aug 10 that Argentina has agreed to ship Uruguay 60,000 tons of wheat despite her own shortage of wheat; Uruguay originally purchased 140,000 tons of wheat, of which it received 80,000 tons, but Argentines indicated later they would be unable to supply remaining tonnage because of their own shortage

headline.main: Argentina Plans to Ship More Wheat to Uruguay

docs.snippet: Two men, one said to be a member of the outlawed Irish Republican Army, were killed today in an apparent premature explosion of a bomb as they drove in an auto near a border crossing, police officials said.
docs.lead_paragraph: Two men, one said to be a member of the outlawed Irish Republican Army, were killed today in an apparent premature explosion of a bomb as they drove in an auto near a border crossing, police officials said.
docs.abstract: 2 men, S Harvey and G McGlynn, are killed on Aug 11 in apparent premature explosion of bomb as they drove in auto near border crossing, 23 miles southwest of Londonderry, N Ireland; police say Harvey was member of Provisional wing of IRA; in Belfast on Aug 10, gunmen kill Roman Cath Joseph Murphy in execution style as his wife and mother watch helplessly; later, on hearing of his son's death, Murphy's father dies of heart attack

headline.main: World News Briefs; Soviet Dooms Four As Nazi Gunmen Iceland Boat Rams British Frigate Korean Setting Up Kidnapping Study Coca-Cola Officers Leave Argentina Two in Ulster Killed By Their Bomb
ew Jersey; Calendar of Events MUSIC FILMS LECTURES THEATER ART OPENINGS FOR CHILDREN

docs.snippet: It was a superb catastrophe. Wellstructured. Except perhaps for romantic interest-an ingenue saved from frostbite by judicious male body heats-it had a Hollywood shape: grace and sensationalism; dull endurance and flashy heroics.
docs.lead_paragraph: It was a superb catastrophe. Wellstructured. Except perhaps for romantic interest-an ingenue saved from frostbite by judicious male body heats-it had a Hollywood shape: grace and sensationalism; dull endurance and flashy heroics.
docs.abstract: Survive, book by Clay Blair Jr, which describes ordeal of Uruguayan rugby players who were rescued from wreckage of mil aircraft after spending 70 days on Andes mt, revd

headline.main: Survive!; By Clay Blair Jr. Illustrated. 280 pp. New York: Berkley Publishing Corporation. Paper, $1.25.

docs.snippet: Uruguayan Govt imposes on Aug 19 3-mo ban on sale of beef with objective of promoting beef exports
docs.abstract: Uruguayan Govt imposes on Aug 19 3-mo ban on sale of beef with objective of promoting beef exports

docs.snippet: The favorites, Chris Evert and Manuel Orantes, swept to the singles titles today in the $90,000 United States clay-court tennis championships.
docs.lead_paragraph: The favorites, Chris Evert and Manuel Orantes, swept to the singles titles today in the $90,000 United States clay-court tennis championships.
docs.abstract: M Estep defeats G Scott on Aug 19 to win Pennsylvania lawn tennis champ at Haverford; C Dibley and A Stone win doubles champ

headline.main: Chris Evert, Orantes Win Clay Finals; Estep Beats Scott Rupert Team Wins Mrs. Court Triumphs Hetherington Is Victor
